qas.question: Is Burma now a democratic nation?

answers.text: Opinions differ whether the transition to liberal democracy is underway

qas.question: Does the military still have a government presence in Burma ?
What type of government does Burma operate under ?
Does the military presence interfere with the day to day running of the government ?

answers.text: reforms only occurred when the military was able to safeguard its own interests

context: <a0_0>Opinions differ whether the transition to liberal democracy is underway<a0_0/>. According to some reports, <a1_0>the military's presence continues<a1_0/> as the label <a2_0>'disciplined democracy<a2_0/>' suggests. This label asserts that the Burmese military is allowing certain civil liberties while clandestinely institutionalising itself further into Burmese politics. Such an assertion assumes that <a3_0>reforms only occurred when the military was able to safeguard its own interests<a3_0/> through the transition—here, "transition" does not refer to a transition to a liberal democracy, but transition to a quasi-military rule.
